channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12415] Add add(byte[][] arrays) to Bytes.
item.description: Bytes already implements add (byte[] a, byte[] b) and add (byte[] a, byte[] b, byte[] c). Goal of this JIRA is to add a generic add (byte[][] arrays) method.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
patch lgtm

nit:
for (int i = 0; i < arrays.length; i++)
length += arrays[i].length;
To be in curly braces or else in one line
Thanks for looking at it Anoop Sam John! Should have been in curly braces for sure! Updated patch attached.

It'll be nice if some document for the function is added like "Catenation of all the byte arrays." because the name 'add' was kinda confusing to me when I first saw it. I'm not sure whether the results are an array with elements equal to sum of the correponding elements of the input arrays (which is a matlab array 'add').
There was already comments about that in the method I have added, but I just made it more clear (I hope).

Might I ask where can the newly added code add(byte[][] arrays) be used?
Patch lgtm but is there an intended user in HBase Jean-Marc Spaggiari ? Should we change callers of add (byte[] a, byte[] b) and add (byte[] a, byte[] b, byte[] c) to use the new method?

Andrew Purtell
add (byte[] x2) and add (byte[] x 3) don't have to do the loop to count the total size of the array. So they might be few cycles faster. If they are used intensively somewhere, changing them by a call to add (bytes[]...) might have a small impact. Also, if replace them, we need to change the testing code. So I think we should keep it that way

Srikanth Srungarapu
It's an utility class, so can be used anywhere by any client. It is very useful when you "play" with composite keys and you have more than 3 fields.

It's an utility class, so can be used anywhere by any client. It is very useful when you "play" with composite keys and you have more than 3 fields.

Fair enough, Bytes is Public/Stable.

+1

Committed to 0.98+
Thanks for the patch Jean-Marc Spaggiari
